channel.title: jq on ftisiot ideas about food and life

item.title: How to load JSON data in PostgreSQL with the COPY command
item.description:
You have a JSON dataset that you want to upload to a PostgreSQL table containing properly formatted rows and columns… How do you do it?

All the main sources like my own blog and others tell you to load the JSON in a dedicated temporary table containing a unique JSON column, then parse it and load into the target table. However there could be another way, avoiding the temp table!

item.title: Beautify `kcat` consumer output by piping to `jq`
item.description: I was working on some demos recently on the Apache Kafka source connectors (hi #KafkaSummit!), and trying to display the stream of changes in the resulting Apache Kafka topic.
